lines.line_text: Think how welcome dawns Aurora
On the weary trav'ller's eyes;
Think how lovely Phoebus rises,
And adorns the eastern skies:

stanzas.stanza_text:
Think how welcome dawns Aurora
On the weary trav'ller's eyes;
Think how lovely Phoebus rises,
And adorns the eastern skies:

lines.line_text: Full as welcome, and as lovely,
To the fair Camilla's sight,
Did appear her valiant lover,
Through the solemn gloom of night.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Full as welcome, and as lovely,
To the fair Camilla's sight,
Did appear her valiant lover,
Through the solemn gloom of night.

lines.line_text: Both, with looks of heartfelt sorrow,
Gaz'd awhile, but neither spoke;
Till at length, the brave Alonzo,
Thus with sighs the silence broke.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Both, with looks of heartfelt sorrow,
Gaz'd awhile, but neither spoke;
Till at length, the brave Alonzo,
Thus with sighs the silence broke.

lines.line_text: Canst thou hear, too lovely lady?
Will thy tender heart not break?
I must go, perhaps forever;
Here my last farewell I take.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Canst thou hear, too lovely lady?
Will thy tender heart not break?
I must go, perhaps forever;
Here my last farewell I take.

lines.line_text: But think not now, my dear Camilla,
Tho' through foreign climes I range,
Gold or beauty e'er shall tempt me;
This fond heart can never change.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But think not now, my dear Camilla,
Tho' through foreign climes I range,
Gold or beauty e'er shall tempt me;
This fond heart can never change.

lines.line_text: What tho' fate condemns thy lover
Once again to shine in arms;
Fortune yet may make Alonzo
More deserving of thy charms.

stanzas.stanza_text:
What tho' fate condemns thy lover
Once again to shine in arms;
Fortune yet may make Alonzo
More deserving of thy charms.

lines.line_text: Ah! reply'd th' afflicted lady,
With a look that pierc'd his heart,
I will ne'er survive to see thee;
Here forever we must part.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Ah! reply'd th' afflicted lady,
With a look that pierc'd his heart,
I will ne'er survive to see thee;
Here forever we must part.

lines.line_text: Think, ah! think, my dear Alonzo,
When to of fame you rise;
Here, depriv'd of friends and fortune,
Thy once lov'd Camilla dies.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Think, ah! think, my dear Alonzo,
When to of fame you rise;
Here, depriv'd of friends and fortune,
Thy once lov'd Camilla dies.

lines.line_text: For thy sake, my cruel uncle,
Drives the orphan from his door;
Thus distress'd, I flew to meet thee,
But will never see thee more.

stanzas.stanza_text:
For thy sake, my cruel uncle,
Drives the orphan from his door;
Thus distress'd, I flew to meet thee,
But will never see thee more.

lines.line_text: Dost thou think, says brave Alonzo,
I could leave thee thus forlorn?
No, this sword shall guard Camilla;
Fame and fortune both I scorn.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Dost thou think, says brave Alonzo,
I could leave thee thus forlorn?
No, this sword shall guard Camilla;
Fame and fortune both I scorn.

lines.line_text: In yon castle I've a mother,
Tender as Camilla's fair;
For my sake she'll fondly love thee,
If her friendly roof thou'lt share.

stanzas.stanza_text:
In yon castle I've a mother,
Tender as Camilla's fair;
For my sake she'll fondly love thee,
If her friendly roof thou'lt share.

lines.line_text: Let me take thee to her bower,
She will soothe thy gentle breast;
Nor refuse thy ardent lover
What will make him truly blest.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Let me take thee to her bower,
She will soothe thy gentle breast;
Nor refuse thy ardent lover
What will make him truly blest.

lines.line_text: Softly sigh'd the wounded maiden
Thus upon her bended knee,
Leave me, dear Alonzo, leave me
This can never, never be.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Softly sigh'd the wounded maiden
Thus upon her bended knee,
Leave me, dear Alonzo, leave me
This can never, never be.

lines.line_text: Is Camilla then dependent,
Abject as a common slave;
Death to me has lost his terrors,
First I'll sink in yonder wave.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Is Camilla then dependent,
Abject as a common slave;
Death to me has lost his terrors,
First I'll sink in yonder wave.

lines.line_text: Is it thus you term my passion,
Said the conscious noble swain;
Then, proud maid, indeed I'll leave you,
Since my love has prov'd in vain.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Is it thus you term my passion,
Said the conscious noble swain;
Then, proud maid, indeed I'll leave you,
Since my love has prov'd in vain.

lines.line_text: But may Heaven guard Camilla,
Tho' I bid a last adieu;
Never more will I love woman,
Since I'm treated thus by you.

stanzas.stanza_text:
But may Heaven guard Camilla,
Tho' I bid a last adieu;
Never more will I love woman,
Since I'm treated thus by you.

lines.line_text: On the earth's cold bosom lying,
Fair Camilla breath'd her last;
Time's sleet wing is arm'd with sorrow,
Why relate the woe that's past?

stanzas.stanza_text:
On the earth's cold bosom lying,
Fair Camilla breath'd her last;
Time's sleet wing is arm'd with sorrow,
Why relate the woe that's past?
